repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Electric Sector
            Investment & Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Electric Sector Investment &
            Management Project of the West Bank and Gaza had the
            following ratings: outcomes were moderately satisfactory,
            risk to development outcome was high, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and borrower performance was satisfactory. The
            lessons learned included: 1) The project reinforces previous
            experience regarding the importance of maintaining
            flexibility in project implementation when working in
            conflict areas; 2) The impact of political factors on the
            corporatization and commercialization of state-owned
            enterprises should not be underestimated. This is
            particularly true when the revenues of the enterprise have
            previously formed part of the general revenues of the
            government; 3) Tied co-financing carries special risks,
            especially if manufacturers in the co-financing country
            specialize in products that are not technologically
            compatible with the Borrower's systems; 4) A
            centralized Project Management Unit would have helped to
            ensure better co-ordination between the various implementing
            agencies as well as providing appropriate
            technical/procurement support mainly in contract management
            to these agencies; and 5) The high customs duties imposed by
            Israel on the imported goods have hindered and slow the
            successful implementation of contracts by the implementing
            agencies. Such situation has worsened by the reluctance of
            Israel to give back such levies. This situation is expected
            to be experienced in future project and therefore should be
            addressed during future project preparation.

5084013.trustfund:
TF026092-ELECTRIC SECTOR INVESTMENT AND MANAGEMENT,TF035811-WEST BANK AND GAZA -

5084013.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Electric Sector
            Investment and Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Electric Sector Investment and Management Project for the
            West Bank and Gaza is to benefit electricity consumers,
            predominantly households, through sustainable improvements
            in the quality of electricity supply. There are three main
            components. The first rehabilitates and upgrades electric
            utility distribution facilities in the central West Bank and
            the Hebron governorate, and implements a distribution
            dispatching center for the Jerusalem District Electric
            Company (JDEC0). The second component finances a management
            contract and technical assistance to strengthen sector
            institutions. It comprises four sub-components: 1) the
            three-year cost (fixed fees and performance incentive) of a
            performance-based management contract for the Southern
            Electric Company; 2) technical assistance to JDECo in areas
            where its own capacity has potential for improvement; 3)
            technical assistance to help the municipality of Hebron
            corporatize and commercialize its electric utility
            operations (business plan implementation); and 4) technical
            assistance to the Palestinian Energy Authority to implement
            the actions specified in the Letter of Sector Development
            Policy. The third component funds initial startup and
            operating expenditures, and helps to strengthen both the
            Hebron and Southern electric companies' capacities to
            operate as financially sound and technically capable power
            distribution companies.
